JwtBase.description: The base structure of a JWT token

exp.description: Unix timestamp of when the token expires

iat.description: Unix timestamp of when the token was issued

iss.description: The issuer of the token, usually will equal to "api-gateway"

meta.description: The meta object contains additional information about the token, or the token's owner

nbf.description: Unix timestamp of when the token becomes active

sub.description: The subject of the token, user id, sales channel id, micro service id, etc.

JwtCockpit.description: The structure of a JWT token for an cockpit user.

exp.description: Unix timestamp of when the token expires

iat.description: Unix timestamp of when the token was issued

iss.description: The issuer of the token, usually will equal to "api-gateway"

meta.description: The meta object contains additional information about the token, or the token's owner

nbf.description: Unix timestamp of when the token becomes active

sub.description: The user id of the cockpit user

type.description: For cockpit tokens, the type will always be "cockpit"

JwtCustomer.description: The structure of a JWT token for a customer of an authenticated sales channel

exp.description: Unix timestamp of when the token expires

iat.description: Unix timestamp of when the token was issued

iss.description: The issuer of the token, usually will equal to "api-gateway"

meta.description: The meta object contains additional information about the token, or the token's owner

accessKey.description: The sales channel access key of the headless shop

contextToken.description: The sales channel context token of the headless shop

customerGroupId.description: The group id of the customer inside of the sales channel

customerIdentifier.description: A from the external sales channel provided customer id

email.description: The customer's email address, in most cases only available if guest is false

externalGroupName.description: The external group name of the customer

guest.description: Is the customer an guest customer?

salesChannelId.description: The sales channel id of the customer

nbf.description: Unix timestamp of when the token becomes active

sub.description: The user id of the customer

type.description: For customer tokens, the type will always be "customer"

JwtInternal.description: The structure of a JWT token for an internal micro service. A token of this type will only be used for internal communication between micro services.

exp.description: Unix timestamp of when the token expires

iat.description: Unix timestamp of when the token was issued

iss.description: The issuer of the token, usually will equal to "api-gateway"

meta.description: The meta object contains additional information about the token, or the token's owner

targetServiceId.description: The service names, for which this token can be use.

nbf.description: Unix timestamp of when the token becomes active

sub.description: The internal micro service id, which requested the token

type.description: For internal tokens, the type will always be "internal"

JwtSalesChannel.description: The structure of a JWT token for a registered sales channel Sales channels can request customer tokens with this token

exp.description: Unix timestamp of when the token expires

iat.description: Unix timestamp of when the token was issued

iss.description: The issuer of the token, usually will equal to "api-gateway"

meta.description: The meta object contains additional information about the token, or the token's owner

accessKey.description: The sales channel access key of the headless shop

nbf.description: Unix timestamp of when the token becomes active

type.description: For sales-channel tokens, the type will always be "sales-channel"
